result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick Devonte Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater, Mandatory Minimum - Repeat Firearm Crimes], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain a valid driver's license.
Complete a cognitive thinking program.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick Devonte Lee

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed.

Defendant Frederick Devonte Lee appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Frederick Devonte Lee.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Mandatory minimum enhancer does not apply as to Count 1.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS with 145 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Full-time work/school. 
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- Complete a cognitive thinking program. 
- Provide DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. 

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed:  Jury Instructions.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Frederick Devonte Lee not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Frederick Devonte Lee in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Frederick Devonte Lee in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a final pre-trial.  Court allows defense to withdraw prompt disposition request and vacates the jury trial set on June 27, 2022.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: Defense's Motion to Adjourn and Withdraw Prompt Disposition Request.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Frederick Devonte Lee not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Prompt disposition request filed.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Frederick Devonte Lee in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Frederick Devonte Lee in custody at RCI.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #18CF3452.  Sworn for the State: City of MKE Police Officer Mohammad Abdulghani.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Request for Prompt Disposition.

Defendant Frederick Devonte Lee not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant was present by video from RCI prior to the case being called on the record. Defense Attorney is not present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial.
Received and Filed:  Notice of Expert Testimony.
Received and Filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Frederick Devonte Lee in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Frederick Devonte Lee in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Frederick Devonte Lee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance scheduled via Zoom. Defendant is in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Appearance has been cancelled.  Intake Coordinator will reschedule.
OTP
